profile_data.summary:
As a Senior Software Engineer with a Master’s degree in Computer Science from California State University, I bring over 5 years of industry expertise in developing scalable and secure solutions. My experience includes impactful contributions at Accenture, where I implemented J2EE Application Development and REST API endpoints for Kaiser Permanente's Broker Compensation Services team, along with migrating CI/CD pipelines from Jenkins to GitLab. At Bosch, I served as a Senior Software Engineer and Scrum Master under a Product Owner, working on IBM DOORS and collaborating closely with clients like BMW, Volkswagen, and Volvo.

With a strong foundation in core Java applications, I’m proficient in Spring, microservices architecture, and frontend technologies like React. My technical toolkit and process improvements have consistently driven innovation, leading to efficient, customer-focused solutions. I’m currently seeking full-time software engineering roles to continue advancing my career by delivering impactful and effective solutions.
profile_data.headline: Actively Seeking Full-Time Opportunities | MS in Computer Science | Senior Software Engineer | Certified Full-Stack Automation Engineer

experience.description:
• Assist students with code debugging, troubleshooting, and optimization in the Embedded Systems Lab.

• Grade assignments and provide constructive feedback to improve student understanding.

• Test and debug hardware components using the MSP 432 microcontroller.

• Aid in resolving software issues involving C programming, enhancing my technical skills and ability to explain complex concepts effectively.
experience.title: Instructional Student Assistant

experience.description:
* Work with the engineering team to analyze, design, code, test, and deploy new user stories and product features with high quality to production, including DXL scripting for performance optimization.

* Mentor early-career engineers, providing learning and work-related tasks, focusing on DXL scripting for automation.

* Guide team in application, system, and architecture design decisions, emphasizing IBM Rational DOORS implementation.

* Proactively address issues and create design solutions for reliability, with a focus on task automation using DXL scripting.

* Collaborate with end users to discuss requirements and provide demos, ensuring alignment with their needs.

* Ensure team commitments through effective communication, task management and enhance team productivity through task planning and collaboration.
experience.title: Senior Software Engineer

experience.description:
• Design, build and configure applications to meet business process and application requirements.

• Worked throughout all the phases of SDLC (both in waterfall and agile) from Requirement Gathering, Capacity Planning, Design, Development, Unit & Assembly testing, Deployment & Production Support.

• Developed robust reusable report dashboard that was provisioned to generate automated reports for the users for any given modules whose queries can be updated in the backend DB.

• Implemented Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment (CI/CD) pipelines using Jenkins to streamline the deployment process and ensure consistent delivery of high-quality software.

• Automated the quarterly business reports which extracts the agents enrolled in Kaiser on a quarterly basis which was done manually by users earlier.

• Involved in migration of existing applications to cloud server that includes prepping up the application on each environment and handling a team to validate the applications sequentially.

• Performed as Technical POC for resolving various technical issues in the different modules of the project and resolve various technical challenges faced by the team.

• Experienced in working under tight SLA guidelines for Application maintenance and batch support. Triage & Fix production incidents reported in Applications and solved within SLA timelines.
experience.title: Software Engineer

experience.description:
• Experienced in developing web application using J2EE technologies such as core Java, PL/SQL, JDBC, Servlets, JSP,Spring and Hibernate.

• Created modules using procedures and functions and integrated the same with JAVA which includes coding complex Procedures, Functions, Triggers, etc.

• Involved in fine tuning of queries which were impacting the system performance by taking longer time for its execution.

• Worked in various JAVA APIs and utility packages which includes password less SFTP, AES encryption/decryption and BASE64 encoding techniques.

• Identified and fixed several security vulnerabilities as part of TRO which includes Click Jacking, Cross site scripting, SQL injection, etc., and managed a team to fix and work on the same.

• Worked in WAS 8.5 & WAS 9.0 (admin console & also server side) for deployment and server related requirements.

• Worked in Struts framework to Spring MVC framework conversion. And worked in Informatica to PL/SQL conversion.
experience.title: Associate Software Engineer

member.occupation: Actively Seeking Full-Time Opportunities | MS in Computer Science | Senior Software Engineer | Certified Full-Stack Automation Engineer

projects.description:
Developed a robust action classification model leveraging transformer networks to analyze inertial data from various activities. The project involved processing and augmenting sensor data, implementing advanced machine learning techniques, and validating the model through 5-fold 
cross-validation.
Key Achievements:

High Accuracy: Achieved an average cross-validation accuracy of 92%, significantly outperforming the initial 85.71% normal accuracy.

Consistency and Robustness: Maintained consistent performance with a weighted average precision of 0.7548 across various action classes.

Data Augmentation: Enhanced training data with Gaussian noise and time shifts to improve model generalization.

Advanced Model Architecture: Utilized a complex transformer model with multiple residual blocks and dropout layers for regularization.
projects.title: Action Classification Using Transformer Networks on Inertial Data

member.occupation: Actively Seeking Full-Time Opportunities | MS in Computer Science | Senior Software Engineer | Certified Full-Stack Automation Engineer

projects.description:
Developed a new MapReduce scheduling scheme, Degraded-First Scheduling, to enhance performance in erasure-coded clustered storage systems during failure mode.

Conceptualized and implemented the strategy of launching degraded tasks earlier to utilize unused network resources effectively.

Created a discrete event simulator for MapReduce to evaluate the performance gains of Degraded-First Scheduling in large-scale clusters.
projects.title: Degraded-First Scheduling in MapReduce for Erasure-Coded Clustered Storage Systems
